00058 /* helper to find edge for edge_rip */
00059 static float edbm_rip_rip_edgedist(ARegion *ar, float mat[][4], float *co1, float *co2, const float mvalf[2])
00060 {
00061     float vec1[3], vec2[3];
00062 
00063     ED_view3d_project_float_v2(ar, co1, vec1, mat);
00064     ED_view3d_project_float_v2(ar, co2, vec2, mat);
00065 
00066     return dist_to_line_segment_v2(mvalf, vec1, vec2);
00067 }
00068 
00069 static float edbm_rip_edge_side_measure(BMEdge *e, BMLoop *e_l,
00070                                         ARegion *ar,
00071                                         float projectMat[4][4], const float fmval[2])
00072 {
00073     float cent[3] = {0, 0, 0}, mid[3];
00074 
00075     float vec[2];
00076     float fmval_tweak[2];
00077     float e_v1_co[2], e_v2_co[2];
00078     float score;
00079 
00080     BMVert *v1_other;
00081     BMVert *v2_other;
00082 
00083     BLI_assert(BM_vert_in_edge(e, e_l->v));
00084 
00085     /* method for calculating distance:
00086      *
00087      * for each edge: calculate face center, then made a vector
00088      * from edge midpoint to face center.  offset edge midpoint
00089      * by a small amount along this vector. */
00090 
00091     /* rather then the face center, get the middle of
00092      * both edge verts connected to this one */
00093     v1_other = BM_face_other_vert_loop(e_l->f, e->v2, e->v1)->v;
00094     v2_other = BM_face_other_vert_loop(e_l->f, e->v1, e->v2)->v;
00095     mid_v3_v3v3(cent, v1_other->co, v2_other->co);
00096     mid_v3_v3v3(mid, e->v1->co, e->v2->co);
00097 
00098     ED_view3d_project_float_v2(ar, cent, cent, projectMat);
00099     ED_view3d_project_float_v2(ar, mid, mid, projectMat);
00100 
00101     ED_view3d_project_float_v2(ar, e->v1->co, e_v1_co, projectMat);
00102     ED_view3d_project_float_v2(ar, e->v2->co, e_v2_co, projectMat);
00103 
00104     sub_v2_v2v2(vec, cent, mid);
00105     normalize_v2(vec);
00106     mul_v2_fl(vec, 0.01f);
00107 
00108     /* rather then adding to both verts, subtract from the mouse */
00109     sub_v2_v2v2(fmval_tweak, fmval, vec);
00110 
00111     score = len_v2v2(e_v1_co, e_v2_co);
00112 
00113     if (dist_to_line_segment_v2(fmval_tweak, e_v1_co, e_v2_co) >
00114         dist_to_line_segment_v2(fmval,       e_v1_co, e_v2_co))
00115     {
00116         return  score;
00117     }
00118     else {
00119         return -score;
00120     }
00121 }

00124 /* - Advanced selection handling 'ripsel' functions ----- */
00125 
00156 #define IS_VISIT_POSSIBLE(e)   (BM_edge_is_manifold(e) && BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_TAG))
00157 #define IS_VISIT_DONE(e) ((e)->l && (BM_elem_index_get((e)->l) != INVALID_UID))
00158 #define INVALID_UID INT_MIN
00159 
00160 /* mark, assign uid and step */
00161 static BMEdge *edbm_ripsel_edge_mark_step(BMVert *v, const int uid)
00162 {
00163     BMIter iter;
00164     BMEdge *e;
00165     BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00166         if (IS_VISIT_POSSIBLE(e) && !IS_VISIT_DONE(e)) {
00167             BMLoop *l_a, *l_b;
00168 
00169             BM_edge_loop_pair(e, &l_a, &l_b); /* no need to check, we know this will be true */
00170 
00171             /* so (IS_VISIT_DONE == TRUE) */
00172             BM_elem_index_set(l_a, uid);
00173             BM_elem_index_set(l_b, uid);
00174 
00175             return e;
00176         }
00177     }
00178     return NULL;
00179 }
00180 
00181 typedef struct EdgeLoopPair {
00182     BMLoop *l_a;
00183     BMLoop *l_b;
00184 } EdgeLoopPair;
00185 
00186 static EdgeLoopPair *edbm_ripsel_looptag_helper(BMesh *bm)
00187 {
00188     BMIter fiter;
00189     BMIter liter;
00190 
00191     BMFace *f;
00192     BMLoop *l;
00193 
00194     int uid_start;
00195     int uid_end;
00196     int uid = bm->totedge; /* can start anywhere */
00197 
00198     EdgeLoopPair *eloop_pairs = NULL;
00199     BLI_array_declare(eloop_pairs);
00200     EdgeLoopPair *lp;
00201 
00202     /* initialize loops with dummy invalid index values */
00203     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &fiter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00204         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00205             BM_elem_index_set(l, INVALID_UID);
00206         }
00207     }
00208 
00209     /* set contiguous loops ordered 'uid' values for walking after split */
00210     while (TRUE) {
00211         int tot = 0;
00212         BMIter eiter;
00213         BMEdge *e_step;
00214         BMVert *v_step;
00215         BMEdge *e;
00216         BMEdge *e_first;
00217         BMEdge *e_last;
00218 
00219         e_first = NULL;
00220         BM_ITER_MESH (e, &eiter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00221             if (IS_VISIT_POSSIBLE(e) && !IS_VISIT_DONE(e)) {
00222                 e_first = e;
00223                 break;
00224             }
00225         }
00226 
00227         if (e_first == NULL) {
00228             break;
00229         }
00230 
00231         /* initialize  */
00232         e_first = e;
00233         v_step = e_first->v1;
00234         e_step = NULL; /* quiet warning, will never remain this value */
00235 
00236         uid_start = uid;
00237         while ((e = edbm_ripsel_edge_mark_step(v_step, uid))) {
00238             BM_elem_flag_disable(e, BM_ELEM_SMOOTH);
00239             v_step = BM_edge_other_vert((e_step = e), v_step);
00240             uid++; /* only different line */
00241             tot++;
00242         }
00243 
00244         /* this edges loops have the highest uid's, store this to walk down later */
00245         e_last = e_step;
00246 
00247         /* always store the highest 'uid' edge for the stride */
00248         uid_end = uid - 1;
00249         uid = uid_start - 1;
00250 
00251         /* initialize */
00252         v_step = e_first->v1;
00253 
00254         while ((e = edbm_ripsel_edge_mark_step(v_step, uid))) {
00255             BM_elem_flag_disable(e, BM_ELEM_SMOOTH);
00256             v_step = BM_edge_other_vert((e_step = e), v_step);
00257             uid--; /* only different line */
00258             tot++;
00259         }
00260 
00261         /* stride far enough not to _ever_ overlap range */
00262         uid_start = uid;
00263         uid = uid_end + bm->totedge;
00264 
00265         BLI_array_growone(eloop_pairs);
00266         lp = &eloop_pairs[BLI_array_count(eloop_pairs) - 1];
00267         BM_edge_loop_pair(e_last, &lp->l_a, &lp->l_b); /* no need to check, we know this will be true */
00268 
00269 
00270         BLI_assert(tot == uid_end - uid_start);
00271 
00272 #if 0
00273         printf("%s: found contiguous edge loop of (%d)\n", __func__, uid_end - uid_start);
00274 #endif
00275 
00276     }
00277 
00278     /* null terminate */
00279     BLI_array_growone(eloop_pairs);
00280     lp = &eloop_pairs[BLI_array_count(eloop_pairs) - 1];
00281     lp->l_a = lp->l_b = NULL;
00282 
00283     return eloop_pairs;
00284 }

00287 /* - De-Select the worst rip-edge side -------------------------------- */
00288 
00289 
00290 static BMEdge *edbm_ripsel_edge_uid_step(BMEdge *e_orig, BMVert **v_prev)
00291 {
00292     BMIter eiter;
00293     BMEdge *e;
00294     BMVert *v = BM_edge_other_vert(e_orig, *v_prev);
00295     const int uid_cmp = BM_elem_index_get(e_orig->l) - 1;
00296 
00297     BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00298         if (BM_elem_index_get(e->l) == uid_cmp) {
00299             *v_prev = v;
00300             return e;
00301         }
00302     }
00303     return NULL;
00304 }
00305 
00306 static BMVert *edbm_ripsel_edloop_pair_start_vert(BMEdge *e)
00307 {
00308     /* try step in a direction, if it fails we know do go the other way */
00309     BMVert *v_test = e->v1;
00310     return (edbm_ripsel_edge_uid_step(e, &v_test)) ? e->v1 : e->v2;
00311 }
00312 
00313 static void edbm_ripsel_deselect_helper(BMesh *bm, EdgeLoopPair *eloop_pairs,
00314                                         ARegion *ar, float projectMat[4][4], float fmval[2])
00315 {
00316     EdgeLoopPair *lp;
00317 
00318     for (lp = eloop_pairs; lp->l_a; lp++) {
00319         BMEdge *e;
00320         BMVert *v_prev;
00321 
00322         float score_a = 0.0f;
00323         float score_b = 0.0f;
00324 
00325         e = lp->l_a->e;
00326         v_prev = edbm_ripsel_edloop_pair_start_vert(e);
00327         for (; e; e = edbm_ripsel_edge_uid_step(e, &v_prev)) {
00328             score_a += edbm_rip_edge_side_measure(e, e->l, ar, projectMat, fmval);
00329         }
00330         e = lp->l_b->e;
00331         v_prev = edbm_ripsel_edloop_pair_start_vert(e);
00332         for (; e; e = edbm_ripsel_edge_uid_step(e, &v_prev)) {
00333             score_b += edbm_rip_edge_side_measure(e, e->l, ar, projectMat, fmval);
00334         }
00335 
00336         e = (score_a > score_b) ? lp->l_a->e : lp->l_b->e;
00337         v_prev = edbm_ripsel_edloop_pair_start_vert(e);
00338         for (; e; e = edbm_ripsel_edge_uid_step(e, &v_prev)) {
00339             BM_edge_select_set(bm, e, FALSE);
00340         }
00341     }
00342 }
00343 /* --- end 'ripsel' selection handling code --- */
00344 
00345 static int edbm_rip_call_edgesplit(BMEditMesh *em, wmOperator *op)
00346 {
00347     BMOperator bmop;
00348 
00349     if (!EDBM_op_init(em, &bmop, op, "edgesplit edges=%he verts=%hv use_verts=%b",
00350                       BM_ELEM_TAG, BM_ELEM_SELECT, TRUE)) {
00351         return FALSE;
00352     }
00353     BMO_op_exec(em->bm, &bmop);
00354     if (!EDBM_op_finish(em, &bmop, op, TRUE)) {
00355         return FALSE;
00356     }
00357 
00358     return TRUE;
00359 }
00360 
00364 static int edbm_rip_invoke__vert(bContext *C, wmOperator *op, wmEvent *event)
00365 {
00366     Object *obedit = CTX_data_edit_object(C);
00367     ARegion *ar = CTX_wm_region(C);
00368     RegionView3D *rv3d = CTX_wm_region_view3d(C);
00369     BMEditMesh *em = BMEdit_FromObject(obedit);
00370     BMesh *bm = em->bm;
00371     BMIter iter, liter;
00372     BMLoop *l;
00373     BMEdge *e, *e2;
00374     BMVert *v, *ripvert = NULL;
00375     const int totvert_orig = bm->totvert;
00376     int i;
00377     float projectMat[4][4], fmval[3] = {event->mval[0], event->mval[1]};
00378     float dist = FLT_MAX;
00379     float d;
00380 
00381     BMEditSelection ese;
00382     int totboundary_edge = 0;
00383 
00384     ED_view3d_ob_project_mat_get(rv3d, obedit, projectMat);
00385 
00386     /* find selected vert - same some time and check history first */
00387     if (BM_select_history_active_get(em->bm, &ese) && ese.htype == BM_VERT) {
00388         v = (BMVert *)ese.ele;
00389     }
00390     else {
00391         ese.ele = NULL;
00392 
00393         BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00394             if (BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_SELECT))
00395                 break;
00396         }
00397     }
00398 
00399     /* this should be impossible, but sanity checks are a good thing */
00400     if (!v)
00401         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00402 
00403     e2 = NULL;
00404 
00405     if (v->e) {
00406         /* find closest edge to mouse cursor */
00407         BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00408             int is_boundary = BM_edge_is_boundary(e);
00409             /* consider wire as boundary for this purpose,
00410              * otherwise we can't a face away from a wire edge */
00411             totboundary_edge += (is_boundary != 0 || BM_edge_is_wire(e));
00412             if (!BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00413                 if (is_boundary == FALSE && BM_edge_is_manifold(e)) {
00414                     d = edbm_rip_rip_edgedist(ar, projectMat, e->v1->co, e->v2->co, fmval);
00415                     if (d < dist) {
00416                         dist = d;
00417                         e2 = e;
00418                     }
00419                 }
00420             }
00421         }
00422 
00423     }
00424 
00425     /* should we go ahead with edge rip or do we need to do special case, split off vertex?:
00426      * split off vertex if...
00427      * - we cant find an edge - this means we are ripping a faces vert that is connected to other
00428      *   geometry only at the vertex.
00429      * - the boundary edge total is greater then 2,
00430      *   in this case edge split _can_ work but we get far nicer results if we use this special case. */
00431     if (totboundary_edge > 2) {
00432         BMVert **vout;
00433         int vout_len;
00434 
00435         BM_vert_select_set(bm, v, FALSE);
00436 
00437         if (bmesh_vert_separate(bm, v, &vout, &vout_len) == FALSE) {
00438             BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Error ripping vertex from faces");
00439             return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00440         }
00441         else if (vout_len < 2) {
00442             MEM_freeN(vout);
00443             /* set selection back to avoid active-unselected vertex */
00444             BM_vert_select_set(bm, v, TRUE);
00445             /* should never happen */
00446             BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Error ripping vertex from faces");
00447             return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00448         }
00449         else {
00450             int vi_best = 0;
00451 
00452             if (ese.ele) {
00453                 BM_select_history_remove(em->bm, ese.ele);
00454             }
00455 
00456             dist = FLT_MAX;
00457 
00458             for (i = 0; i < vout_len; i++) {
00459                 BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &iter, vout[i], BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT) {
00460                     if (!BM_elem_flag_test(l->f, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00461                         float l_mid_co[3];
00462                         BM_loop_calc_face_tangent(l, l_mid_co);
00463 
00464                         /* scale to average of surrounding edge size, only needs to be approx */
00465                         mul_v3_fl(l_mid_co, (BM_edge_calc_length(l->e) + BM_edge_calc_length(l->prev->e)) / 2.0f);
00466                         add_v3_v3(l_mid_co, v->co);
00467 
00468                         d = edbm_rip_rip_edgedist(ar, projectMat, v->co, l_mid_co, fmval);
00469 
00470                         if (d < dist) {
00471                             dist = d;
00472                             vi_best = i;
00473                         }
00474                     }
00475                 }
00476             }
00477 
00478             /* select the vert from the best region */
00479             v = vout[vi_best];
00480             BM_vert_select_set(bm, v, TRUE);
00481 
00482             if (ese.ele) {
00483                 BM_select_history_store(em->bm, v);
00484             }
00485 
00486             /* splice all others back together */
00487             if (vout_len > 2) {
00488 
00489                 /* vout[0]  == best
00490                  * vout[1]  == glue
00491                  * vout[2+] == splice with glue
00492                  */
00493                 if (vi_best != 0) {
00494                     SWAP(BMVert *, vout[0], vout[vi_best]);
00495                     vi_best = 0;
00496                 }
00497 
00498                 for (i = 2; i < vout_len; i++) {
00499                     BM_vert_splice(bm, vout[i], vout[1]);
00500                 }
00501             }
00502 
00503             MEM_freeN(vout);
00504 
00505             return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00506         }
00507     }
00508 
00509     if (!e2) {
00510         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Selected vertex has no edge/face pairs attached");
00511         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00512     }
00513 
00514     /* rip two adjacent edges */
00515     if (BM_edge_is_boundary(e2) || BM_vert_face_count(v) == 2) {
00516         l = e2->l;
00517         ripvert = BM_face_vert_separate(bm, l->f, v);
00518 
00519         BLI_assert(ripvert);
00520         if (!ripvert) {
00521             return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00522         }
00523     }
00524     else if (BM_edge_is_manifold(e2)) {
00525         l = e2->l;
00526         e = BM_face_other_edge_loop(l->f, e2, v)->e;
00527         BM_elem_flag_enable(e, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00528 
00529         l = e2->l->radial_next;
00530         e = BM_face_other_edge_loop(l->f, e2, v)->e;
00531         BM_elem_flag_enable(e, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00532     }
00533 
00534     dist = FLT_MAX;
00535 
00536     if (!edbm_rip_call_edgesplit(em, op)) {
00537         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00538     }
00539     else {
00540         /* --- select which vert --- */
00541         BMVert *v_best = NULL;
00542         float l_prev_co[3], l_next_co[3], l_corner_co[3];
00543         float scale;
00544 
00545         dist = FLT_MAX;
00546         BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, em->bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00547             if (BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_SELECT)) {
00548                 /* disable by default, re-enable winner at end */
00549                 BM_vert_select_set(bm, v, FALSE);
00550 
00551                 BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, v, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT) {
00552                     /* calculate a point in the face, rather then calculate the middle,
00553                      * make a vector pointing between the 2 edges attached to this loop */
00554                     sub_v3_v3v3(l_prev_co, l->prev->v->co, l->v->co);
00555                     sub_v3_v3v3(l_next_co, l->next->v->co, l->v->co);
00556 
00557                     scale = normalize_v3(l_prev_co) + normalize_v3(l_next_co);
00558                     mul_v3_fl(l_prev_co, scale);
00559                     mul_v3_fl(l_next_co, scale);
00560 
00561                     add_v3_v3v3(l_corner_co, l_prev_co, l_next_co);
00562                     add_v3_v3(l_corner_co, l->v->co);
00563 
00564                     d = edbm_rip_rip_edgedist(ar, projectMat, l->v->co, l_corner_co, fmval);
00565                     if (d < dist) {
00566                         v_best = v;
00567                         dist = d;
00568                     }
00569                 }
00570             }
00571         }
00572 
00573         if (v_best) {
00574             BM_vert_select_set(bm, v_best, TRUE);
00575             if (ese.ele) {
00576                 BM_select_history_store(em->bm, v_best);
00577             }
00578         }
00579     }
00580 
00581     if (totvert_orig == bm->totvert) {
00582         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No vertices could be ripped");
00583         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00584     }
00585 
00586     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00587 }
00588 
00592 static int edbm_rip_invoke__edge(bContext *C, wmOperator *op, wmEvent *event)
00593 {
00594     Object *obedit = CTX_data_edit_object(C);
00595     ARegion *ar = CTX_wm_region(C);
00596     RegionView3D *rv3d = CTX_wm_region_view3d(C);
00597     BMEditMesh *em = BMEdit_FromObject(obedit);
00598     BMesh *bm = em->bm;
00599     BMIter iter, eiter;
00600     BMLoop *l;
00601     BMEdge *e, *e2;
00602     BMVert *v;
00603     const int totedge_orig = bm->totedge;
00604     int i;
00605     float projectMat[4][4], fmval[3] = {event->mval[0], event->mval[1]};
00606 
00607     int totedge;
00608     int all_minifold;
00609 
00610     EdgeLoopPair *eloop_pairs;
00611 
00612     ED_view3d_ob_project_mat_get(rv3d, obedit, projectMat);
00613 
00614     /* important this runs on the original selection, before tempering with tagging */
00615     eloop_pairs = edbm_ripsel_looptag_helper(bm);
00616 
00617     /* expand edge selection */
00618     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00619         e2 = NULL;
00620         i = 0;
00621         totedge = 0;
00622         all_minifold = TRUE;
00623         BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00624 
00625             if (!BM_edge_is_wire(e) &&
00626                 !BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN))
00627             {
00628                 /* important to check selection rather then tag here
00629                  * else we get feedback loop */
00630                 if (BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_SELECT)) {
00631                     e2 = e;
00632                     i++;
00633                 }
00634                 totedge++;
00635             }
00636 
00638             if ((all_minifold == TRUE) && (BM_edge_is_manifold(e) == FALSE)) {
00639                 all_minifold = FALSE;
00640             }
00641         }
00642 
00643         /* single edge, extend */
00644         if (i == 1 && e2->l) {
00645             if ((totedge == 4) || (all_minifold == FALSE)) {
00646                 BMLoop *l_a = e2->l;
00647                 BMLoop *l_b = l_a->radial_next;
00648 
00649                 /* find the best face to follow, this what the edge won't point away from
00650                  * the mouse when there are more then 4 (takes the shortest face fan around) */
00651                 l = (edbm_rip_edge_side_measure(e2, l_a, ar, projectMat, fmval) <
00652                      edbm_rip_edge_side_measure(e2, l_b, ar, projectMat, fmval)) ? l_a : l_b;
00653 
00654                 l = BM_face_other_edge_loop(l->f, e2, v);
00655                 /* important edge is manifold else we can be attempting to split off a fan that don't budge,
00656                  * not crashing but adds duplicate edge. */
00657                 if (BM_edge_is_manifold(l->e)) {
00658                     l = l->radial_next;
00659                     l = BM_face_other_edge_loop(l->f, l->e, v);
00660 
00661                     if (l) {
00662                         BM_elem_flag_enable(l->e, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00663                     }
00664                 }
00665             }
00666             else {
00667                 e = BM_vert_other_disk_edge(v, e2);
00668 
00669                 if (e) {
00670                     BM_elem_flag_enable(e, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00671                 }
00672             }
00673         }
00674     }
00675 
00676     if (!edbm_rip_call_edgesplit(em, op)) {
00677         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00678     }
00679 
00680     /* note: the output of the bmesh operator is ignored, since we built
00681      * the contiguous loop pairs to split already, its possible that some
00682      * edge did not split even though it was tagged which would not work
00683      * as expected (but not crash), however there are checks to ensure
00684      * tagged edges will split. So far its not been an issue. */
00685     edbm_ripsel_deselect_helper(bm, eloop_pairs,
00686                                 ar, projectMat, fmval);
00687     MEM_freeN(eloop_pairs);
00688 
00689     if (totedge_orig == bm->totedge) {
00690         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No edges could be ripped");
00691         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00692     }
00693 
00694     EDBM_selectmode_flush(em);
00695 
00696     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00697 }
00698 
00699 /* based on mouse cursor position, it defines how is being ripped */
00700 static int edbm_rip_invoke(bContext *C, wmOperator *op, wmEvent *event)
00701 {
00702     Object *obedit = CTX_data_edit_object(C);
00703     BMEditMesh *em = BMEdit_FromObject(obedit);
00704     BMesh *bm = em->bm;
00705     BMIter iter;
00706     BMEdge *e;
00707     int singlesel = (bm->totvertsel == 1 && bm->totedgesel == 0 && bm->totfacesel == 0);
00708     int ret;
00709 
00710     /* running in face mode hardly makes sense, so convert to region loop and rip */
00711     if (em->bm->totfacesel) {
00712         /* highly nifty but hard to sypport since the operator can fail and we're left
00713          * with modified selection */
00714         // WM_operator_name_call(C, "MESH_OT_region_to_loop", WM_OP_INVOKE_DEFAULT, NULL);
00715 
00716         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Can't rip selected faces");
00717         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00718     }
00719 
00720     /* note on selection:
00721      * When calling edge split we operate on tagged edges rather then selected
00722      * this is important because the edges to operate on are extended by one,
00723      * but the selection is left alone.
00724      *
00725      * After calling edge split - the duplicated edges have the same selection state as the
00726      * original, so all we do is de-select the far side from the mouse and we have a
00727      * useful selection for grabbing.
00728      */
00729 
00730     /* BM_ELEM_SELECT --> BM_ELEM_TAG */
00731     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, em->bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00732         BM_elem_flag_set(e, BM_ELEM_TAG, BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_SELECT));
00733     }
00734 
00735     /* split 2 main parts of this operator out into vertex and edge ripping */
00736     if (singlesel) {
00737         ret = edbm_rip_invoke__vert(C, op, event);
00738     }
00739     else {
00740         ret = edbm_rip_invoke__edge(C, op, event);
00741     }
00742 
00743     if (ret == OPERATOR_CANCELLED) {
00744         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00745     }
00746 
00747     BLI_assert(singlesel ? (bm->totvertsel > 0) : (bm->totedgesel > 0));
00748 
00749     if (bm->totvertsel == 0) {
00750         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00751     }
00752 
00753     EDBM_update_generic(C, em, TRUE);
00754 
00755     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00756 }
00757 
00758 
00759 void MESH_OT_rip(wmOperatorType *ot)
00760 {
00761     /* identifiers */
00762     ot->name = "Rip";
00763     ot->idname = "MESH_OT_rip";
00764     ot->description = "Disconnect vertex or edges from connected geometry";
00765 
00766     /* api callbacks */
00767     ot->invoke = edbm_rip_invoke;
00768     ot->poll = EM_view3d_poll;
00769 
00770     /* flags */
00771     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER | OPTYPE_UNDO;
00772 
00773     /* to give to transform */
00774     Transform_Properties(ot, P_PROPORTIONAL);
00775     RNA_def_boolean(ot->srna, "mirror", 0, "Mirror Editing", "");
00776 }
Generated on Tue Nov 13 2012 11:54:16 for Blender by  doxygen 1.7.4
